| Section5 = {{Chembox Related Function = alkanes OtherFunctn =
}} }} 'n-Heptane' is the straight-chain alkane with the chemical formula
H 3C(CH 2) 5CH 3 or
C 7H 16 . When used as a test fuel component in anti-knock
test engines, a 100% heptane fuel is the zero point of the octane rating scale
(the 100 point is a 100% iso-octane). Octane number equates to the anti-knock
qualities of a comparison mixture of heptane and isooctane which is expressed as
the percentage of isooctane in heptane and is listed on pumps for gasoline
dispensed in the United States and internationally.
